Uses of HapticEvent in com.uce.userlab.haptics.event
 

Methods in com.uce.userlab.haptics.event with parameters of type HapticEvent
 void HapticListener.deviceCallback(HapticEvent event)
          This methods is fired at a regular intervile to ask for updates from the listeners
 void HapticListener.deviceInput(HapticEvent event)
          This methods is fired when an input has been made on the device or its state has been changed by the user
 void HapticListener.deviceManagementError(HapticEvent event, DeviceException exc)
          This methods is fired when an internal error occures, usualy within a device management loop
 void HapticListener.deviceUpdate(HapticEvent event)
          This methods is fired when an update has been made to the device
 void HapticListenerSupport.fireDeviceCallback(HapticEvent event)
          Fires a Device callback event to all HapticListener objects that are set to be notified
 void HapticListenerSupport.fireDeviceInput(HapticEvent event)
          Fires a Device input event to all HapticListener objects that are set to be notified
 void HapticListenerSupport.fireDeviceManagementError(HapticEvent event, DeviceException exc)
          Fires a Device management error event to all HapticListener objects that are set to be notified
 void HapticListenerSupport.fireDeviceUpdate(HapticEvent event)
          Fires a Device update event to all HapticListener objects that are set to be notified
